answers.q: can you put aluminum foil in an air fryer
answers.a: Yes—most air fryers allow aluminum foil if used properly: place it only in the basket, don’t cover the entire surface or block vents, and weigh it down so it can’t blow into the heater. Avoid acidic/salty foods on foil (they increase leaching) and follow your model’s instructions.

answers.q: how to cook bacon in the oven with aluminum foil
answers.a: Line a rimmed sheet pan with foil, lay bacon in a single layer, and bake at about 400°F/200°C for 15–20 minutes until crisp. For extra crispness use a rack over the foil; pour off the rendered fat and lift off the foil for easy cleanup.
No—rust is iron oxide; aluminum doesn’t rust but instead forms a thin aluminum oxide layer that protects it. In salty or caustic conditions it can still corrode or pit.
No—aluminum isn’t ferromagnetic, so a fridge magnet won’t stick to it. It’s only weakly paramagnetic and may show subtle effects in strong changing magnetic fields.
Yes—aluminum is a lightweight, silvery metal (element 13) used in packaging and cookware; as E173, metallic aluminum is also used as a decorative food color in some regions.
